vulnerabilities.title: blamer vulnerable to Arbitrary Argument Injection via the blameByFile() API
vulnerabilities.description: Versions of the blamer package before 1.0.4 are vulnerable to Arbitrary Argument Injection via the blameByFile() API. The library does not sanitize for user input or validate the given file path conforms to a specific schema, nor does it properly pass command-line flags to the git binary using the double-dash POSIX characters (--) to communicate the end of options.

vulnerabilities.title: Code injection in blamer
vulnerabilities.description: Code injection vulnerability in blamer 1.0.0 and earlier may result in remote code execution when the input can be controlled by an attacker.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command in Blamer
vulnerabilities.description: Blamer versions prior to 1.0.1 allows execution of arbitrary commands. It is possible to inject arbitrary commands as part of the arguments provided to blamer.
